title: Lab 1-1
description: In Lab 1-1, I learned how to create a script inside of an html document, and I use the document.write() function. The function receives a string argument and can be used to output HTML content to a webpage.

title: Lab 1-3
description: In Lab 1-3, I learn how to embed JavaScript into html tags. We do this by using the on-click event handler inside of the input tag, so that when a button is clicked, another element is changed so that a message appears on the screen.

title: Lab 1-5
description: In Lab 1-5, I learn how to debug errors found in the html document. This execise tests my understanding of common errors related to syntax, case sensitivity, function use, and string formatting in JavaScript. All required changes have been completed and documented in the code comments.

title: Lab 2-1
description: In Lab 2-1, I created functions to convert values between Celsius and Fahrenheit. These functions are triggered when the user enters a temperature in either input field on the webpage.

title: Lab 2-3
description: In Lab 2-3, I used JavaScript to show messages when you hover over shapes. It helped me learn how to change page content with events.

title: Lab 2-5
description: In Lab 2-5, I fixed several syntax and logic errors in the JavaScript code. I corrected event handlers, fixed the condition that was preventing the 0 button from working.

title: Lab 3-1
description: In Lab 3-1, I learned how to work with collections of HTML elements using class names in JavaScript. I practiced using loops to add event listeners and created a function that calculates a total based on user interaction. I also learned how to update the content of an HTML element using JavaScript, and how to apply a formatting function to display numeric values as currency.

title: Lab 3-3
description: In Lab 3-3, I learned how to use a for loop to iterate through an array and access data from multiple related arrays. I also learned how to insert a string into a webpage by setting the innerHTML of an element retrieved using its tag name.

title: Lab 3-5
description: In Lab 3-5, I learned how to identify and fix syntax errors in arrays and switch statements, logical errors in calculations, and problems related to calling and defining functions.

title: Lab 4-1
description: In Lab 4-1, I corrected logical errors in the cost calculations and added error handling to check that users enter valid input.

title: Lab 4-3
description: In Lab 4-3, I fixed some syntax errors with variables, added error handling to show a message if the character count goes over the limit, and cleaned up a mistake where the wrong variable name was used. I learned how to handle user input more safely and catch errors using try/catch blocks.

title: Lab 4-5
description: In Lab 4-5, I fixed syntax and logic errors and used console.log() to test and track variable values. This helped me understand how the code was working and made it easier to find issues. I also used the browser’s developer tools to view error messages and figure out what was going wrong.

title: Lab 5-1
description: In Lab 5-1, I learned how to automatically run a function using the setInterval() method in order to update values in the HTML document. I also learned how to access all elements that match a specific CSS selector using the querySelectorAll() method.

title: Lab 5-3
description: In Lab 5-3, I learned how to get content from a web page and use JavaScript to add new things to it. I used a loop to go through heading elements and create links for a table of contents.

title: Lab 5-5
description: In Lab 5-5, I corrected errors in the scrambleTiles() and playConcentration() functions that were preventing the tiles from visually changing as expected when clicked.

title: Lab 6-1
description: In Lab 6-1, I added simple form validation with JavaScript to check that the password meets the pattern and matches the confirmation. I learned how to use setCustomValidity() to show custom error messages.

title: Lab 6-3
description: In Lab 6-3, I copied shipping info to billing and showed a custom error message if fields are left blank. I learned how to handle checkbox events and use the invalid event for form validation.

title: Lab 6-5
description: In Lab 6-5, I fixed errors by using proper event listeners and correcting element properties. I learned how to properly reference form fields and handle user input.

title: Lab 7-1
description: In Lab 7-1, I learned how to use regular expressions to check if a password met certain requirements, like length and character types.

title: Lab 7-3
description: In Lab 7-3, I learned how to use JavaScript to work with dates and times to show how much time is left until New Year's.

title: Lab 7-5
description: In Lab 7-5, I fixed issues with the file input and regex. I also learned how to fix errors with FileReader, regular expressions, and how to correctly calculate and display word length frequencies.

title: Lab 8-1
description: In Lab 8-1, I built a simple timer using a constructor function and prototype method. I created the countdown function, added event listeners, and made a timer object to manage time updates.

title: Lab 8-3
description: In Lab 8-3, I wrote the cart object, created the Pizza and Topping classes, and added methods to handle building a pizza, adding it to a cart, and summarizing it. I also handled the visual pizza preview and updating the cart.

title: Lab 8-5
description: In Lab 8-5, I learned how to correctly use JSON.parse to read data from a file and how to create an object using the 'new' keyword. I fixed errors where JSON.parse was called incorrectly, and added the missing 'new' keyword when creating the chessSet object.

title: Lab 9-1
description: In Lab 9-1, I learned how to read values from a URL query string, parse the string, and use the values to update page content.

title: Lab 9-3
description: In Lab 9-3, I learned how to store and retrieve data using localStorage to track the user's last visit and label new articles.

title: Lab 9-5
description: In Lab 9-5, I learned how to spot and fix errors when accessing and parsing sessionStorage key value pairs. I fixed problems with sessionStorage key names and method calls.

title: Lab 10-1
description: In Lab 10-1, I learned how to make puzzle pieces draggable by using pointer events. I added code to move a piece when it’s clicked and dragged, and to stop moving it when the pointer is released.

title: Lab 10-3
description: In Lab 10-3, I learned how to use Google Maps to show bike directions. I added code that shows a map, lets the user pick a starting and ending point, and then draws the route and shows directions when both are selected.

title: Lab 10-5
description: In Lab 10-5, I learned how to spot errors in keyboard input handling for a game. I fixed issues with key input, made letters show up in uppercase, and used the correct event listener method instead of outdated code.

title: Lab 11-1
description: In Lab 11-1, I used the fetch method to get data from NASA’s API and displayed either a video or image based on the media type. It helped me understand how to work with the fetch() method, promises, and JSON.

title: Lab 11-3
description: In Lab 11-3, I learned how JavaScript interacts with a Perl script to fetch and display data, helping me understand browser-server communication.

title: Lab 11-5
description: In lab 11-5, I fixed several issues in the code, including syntax errors in fetch calls, incorrect response handling, and template literal usage. I learned how to properly fetch and handle JSON and XML data.

title: Lab 12-1
description: In Lab 12-1 Description, I learned how to use jQuery to show and hide a submenu on hover with simple, clean code.

title: Lab 12-3
description: In Lab 12-3 Description, I learned how to use jQuery to toggle a list and switch an image when a heading is clicked.

title: Lab 12-5
description: In Lab 12-5 Description, I learned how to fix common jQuery mistakes like missing parentheses, incorrect selectors, broken method chains, improper regex syntax, and using === for comparisons.
